    Run Viterbi HMM for allele-specific copy number inference

    alleleHMM.Rd

    Applies a Hidden Markov Model with Viterbi decoding to infer minor allele copy number, considering both possible phasings (A|B and B|A) for each bin. Unlike [HaplotypeHMM()], this function does not assume consistent phasing within haplotype blocks.

    alleleHMM(
  n,
  x,
  binstates,
  minor_cn,
  loherror = 0.02,
  selftransitionprob = 0.999,
  eps = 1e-12,
  rho = 0,
  likelihood = "binomial"
)

    Arguments

    n

    Integer vector of total read counts per bin.

    x

    Integer vector of B-allele read counts per bin.

    binstates

    Integer vector of total copy number states per bin.

    minor_cn

    Integer vector of possible minor allele copy number states.

    loherror

    Sequencing error rate for LOH regions. Default 0.02.

    selftransitionprob

    Self-transition probability in HMM. Default 0.999.

    eps

    Small value for numerical stability. Default 1e-12.

    rho

    Overdispersion for beta-binomial model. Default 0.0.

    likelihood

    Likelihood model: "binomial" (default) or "betabinomial".

    Value

    A list with: * `minorcn`: Inferred minor allele copy number states * `l`: Matrix of log-likelihoods

    Details

    This function considers both A|B and B|A configurations for each bin by computing likelihoods for both x/n and (n-x)/n and taking the sum.

    See also

    [HaplotypeHMM()] for phased version, [callAlleleSpecificCN()] for full pipeline

    Contents

    Developed by Marc J Williams.
